verses.verse: And the word<WH1697> of Jehovah<WH3068> came to me<WH559>, saying,

Go <WH1980>, and cry<WH7121> in the ears<WH241> of Jerusalem<WH3389>, saying<WH559>, Thus saith<WH559> Jehovah<WH3068>, I remember<WH2142> for thee the kindness<WH2617> of thy youth<WH5271>, the love<WH160> of thine espousals<WH3623>; how thou wentest<WH3212> after<WH310> me in the wilderness<WH4057>, in a land<WH776> that was not sown<WH2232>.

Israel <WH3478> was holiness<WH6944> unto Jehovah<WH3068>, the first-fruits<WH7225> of his increase<WH8393>: all that devour<WH398> him shall be held guilty<WH816>; evil<WH7451> shall come<WH935> upon them<WH5002>, saith Jehovah<WH3068>.
Hear <WH8085> ye the word<WH1697> of Jehovah<WH3068>, O house<WH1004> of Jacob<WH3290>, and all the families<WH4940> of the house<WH1004> of Israel<WH3478>:

thus saith<WH559> Jehovah<WH3068>, What unrighteousness<WH5766> have your fathers<WH1> found<WH4672> in me<WH7368>, that they are gone far from me<WH3212>, and have walked after<WH310> vanity<WH1892>, and are become vain<WH1891>?

Neither said<WH559> they<WH3068>, Where is Jehovah that brought us up<WH5927> out of the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>, that led<WH3212> us through the wilderness<WH4057>, through a land<WH776> of deserts<WH6160> and of pits<WH7745>, through a land<WH776> of drought<WH6723> and of the shadow of death<WH6757>, through a land<WH776> that none<WH376> passed through<WH5674>, and where no man<WH376> dwelt<WH3427>?

And I brought<WH935> you into a plentiful<WH3759> land<WH776>, to eat<WH398> the fruit<WH6529> thereof and the goodness<WH2898> thereof<WH935>; but when ye entered, ye defiled<WH2930> my land<WH776>, and made<WH7760> my heritage<WH5159> an abomination<WH8441>.

The priests<WH3548> said<WH559> not<WH3068>, Where is Jehovah? and they that handle<WH8610> the law<WH8451> knew<WH3045> me not<WH7462>: the rulers also transgressed<WH6586> against me<WH5030>, and the prophets prophesied<WH5012> by Baal<WH1168>, and walked<WH1980> after<WH310> things that do not profit<WH3276>.
Wherefore I will yet contend<WH7378> with you<WH5002>, saith Jehovah<WH3068>, and with your children<WH1121>'s children<WH1121> will I contend<WH7378>.

For pass over<WH5674> to the isles<WH339> of Kittim<WH3794>, and see<WH7200>; and send<WH7971> unto Kedar<WH6938>, and consider<WH995> diligently<WH3966>; and see if there hath been such a thing<WH7200>.
Hath a nation<WH1471> changed<WH3235> its gods<WH430>, which yet are no gods<WH430>? but my people<WH5971> have changed<WH4171> their glory<WH3519> for that which doth not profit<WH3276>.
Be astonished<WH8074>, O ye heavens<WH8064>, at this<WH8175>, and be horribly afraid, be ye very<WH3966> desolate<WH2717>, saith<WH5002> Jehovah<WH3068>.

For my people<WH5971> have committed<WH6213> two<WH8147> evils<WH7451>: they have forsaken<WH5800> me<WH4726>, the fountain of living<WH2416> waters<WH4325>, and hewed them out<WH2672> cisterns<WH877>, broken<WH7665> cisterns<WH877>, that can hold<WH3557> no water<WH4325>.
Is Israel<WH3478> a servant<WH5650>? is he a home-born<WH1004> slave<WH4069>? why is he become a prey<WH957>?

The young lions<WH3715> have roared<WH7580> upon him<WH5414>, and yelled; and they have made<WH7896> his land<WH776> waste<WH8047>: his cities<WH5892> are burned<WH3341> up<WH3427>, without inhabitant.
The children<WH1121> also of Memphis<WH5297> and Tahpanhes<WH8471> have broken<WH7462> the crown of thy head<WH6936>.
Hast thou not procured<WH6213> this unto thyself<WH5800>, in that thou hast forsaken Jehovah<WH3068> thy God<WH430>, when<WH6256> he led<WH3212> thee by the way<WH1870>?

And now what hast thou to do in the way<WH1870> to Egypt<WH4714>, to drink<WH8354> the waters<WH4325> of the Shihor<WH7883>? or what hast thou to do in the way<WH1870> to Assyria<WH804>, to drink<WH8354> the waters<WH4325> of the River<WH5104>?

Thine own wickedness<WH7451> shall correct<WH3256> thee<WH4878>, and thy backslidings shall reprove<WH3198> thee<WH3045>: know therefore and see<WH7200> that it is an evil<WH7451> thing and a bitter<WH4751>, that thou hast forsaken<WH5800> Jehovah<WH3068> thy God<WH430>, and that my fear<WH6345> is not in thee<WH5002>, saith the Lord<WH136>, Jehovah<WH3069> of hosts<WH6635>.

For of old time<WH5769> I have broken<WH7665> thy yoke<WH5923>, and burst<WH5423> thy bonds<WH4147>; and thou saidst<WH559>, I will not serve<WH5674>; for upon every high<WH1364> hill<WH1389> and under every green<WH7488> tree<WH6086> thou didst bow thyself<WH6808>, playing the harlot<WH2181>.

Yet I had planted<WH5193> thee a noble vine<WH8321>, wholly a right<WH571> seed<WH2233>: how then art thou turned<WH2015> into the degenerate branches<WH5494> of a foreign<WH5237> vine unto me<WH1612>?

For though thou wash<WH3526> thee with lye<WH5427>, and take thee much<WH7235> soap<WH1287>, yet thine iniquity<WH5771> is marked<WH3799> before<WH6440> me<WH5002>, saith the Lord<WH136> Jehovah<WH3069>.

How canst thou say<WH559>, I am not defiled<WH2930>, I have not gone<WH1980> after<WH310> the Baalim<WH1168>? see<WH7200> thy way<WH1870> in the valley<WH1516>, know<WH3045> what thou hast done<WH6213>: thou art a swift<WH7031> dromedary<WH1072> traversing<WH8308> her ways<WH1870>;

a wild ass<WH6501> used<WH3928> to the wilderness<WH4057>, that snuffeth up<WH7602> the wind<WH7307> in her desire<WH185>; in her occasion<WH8385> who can turn her away<WH7725>? all they that seek<WH1245> her will not weary<WH3286> themselves<WH2320>; in her month they shall find her<WH4672>.

Withhold <WH4513> thy foot<WH7272> from being unshod<WH3182>, and thy throat<WH1627> from thirst<WH6773>: but thou saidst<WH559>, It is in vain<WH2976>; no<WH157>, for I have loved strangers<WH2114>, and after<WH310> them will I go<WH3212>.

As the thief<WH1590> is ashamed<WH1322> when he is found<WH4672>, so is the house<WH1004> of Israel<WH3478> ashamed<WH3001>; they<WH4428>, their kings, their princes<WH8269>, and their priests<WH3548>, and their prophets<WH5030>;

who say<WH559> to a stock<WH6086>, Thou art my father<WH1>; and to a stone<WH68>, Thou hast brought me forth<WH3205>: for they have turned<WH6437> their back<WH6203> unto me<WH6440>, and not their face; but in the time<WH6256> of their trouble<WH7451> they will say<WH559>, Arise<WH6965>, and save us<WH3467>.

But where are thy gods<WH430> that thou hast made<WH6213> thee<WH6965>? let them arise, if they can save<WH3467> thee in the time<WH6256> of thy trouble<WH7451>: for according to the number<WH4557> of thy cities<WH5892> are thy gods<WH430>, O Judah<WH3063>.
Wherefore will ye contend<WH7378> with me<WH6586>? ye all have transgressed against me<WH5002>, saith Jehovah<WH3068>.

In vain<WH7723> have I smitten<WH5221> your children<WH1121>; they received<WH3947> no correction<WH4148>: your own sword<WH2719> hath devoured<WH398> your prophets<WH5030>, like a destroying<WH7843> lion<WH738>.

O generation<WH1755>, see<WH7200> ye the word<WH1697> of Jehovah<WH3068>. Have I been a wilderness<WH4057> unto Israel<WH3478>? or a land<WH776> of thick darkness<WH3991>? wherefore say<WH559> my people<WH5971>, We are broken loose<WH7300>; we will come no more unto thee<WH935>?
Can a virgin<WH1330> forget<WH7911> her ornaments<WH5716>, or a bride<WH3618> her attire<WH7196>? yet my people<WH5971> have forgotten<WH7911> me days<WH3117> without number<WH4557>.
How trimmest<WH3190> thou thy way<WH1870> to seek<WH1245> love<WH160>! therefore even the wicked women<WH7451> hast thou taught<WH3925> thy ways<WH1870>.

Also in thy skirts<WH3671> is found<WH4672> the blood<WH1818> of the souls<WH5315> of the innocent<WH5355> poor<WH34>: thou didst not find<WH4672> them breaking in<WH4290>; but it is because of all these things.

Yet thou saidst<WH559>, I am innocent<WH5352>; surely his anger<WH639> is turned<WH7725> away from me<WH8199>. Behold, I will enter into judgment with thee<WH559>, because thou sayest, I have not sinned<WH2398>.
Why gaddest thou about<WH235> so much<WH3966> to change<WH8138> thy way<WH1870>? thou shalt be ashamed<WH954> of Egypt<WH4714> also<WH954>, as thou wast ashamed of Assyria<WH804>.

From thence also shalt thou go forth<WH3318>, with thy hands<WH3027> upon thy head<WH7218>: for Jehovah<WH3068> hath rejected<WH3988> those in whom thou trustest<WH4009>, and thou shalt not prosper with them<WH6743>.
